titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory to the Radical right collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by David Jacobs and Justyna Szulc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-19T09:39-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Inventory of collection completed by David Jacobs.

Revised to add the Right wing collection section from the New left collection, New Left boxes 29-31, 14-18, and 1 folder of 41. Two of these folders not appropriate for the radical right collection, Americans for Democratic Action folder plus Anti-Defamation League items have been moved to the American Subject Collection, box 21.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Radical Right Collection)//EN" "radicrig.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: The Radical right collection is comprised of pamphlets, leaflets, newspaper and serial issues, newsletters, bulletins, circulars, and other printed and near-print material issued by right-wing organizations and individuals, largely in the United States. The materials relate to anti-communist, nationalist, fundamentalist, racist, anti-Semitic, neo-Nazi, and other right-wing political movements and concerns in the United States, primarily since World War II. Also includes material relating to world government, education, mental health, fluoridation, and other issues, as well as a few letters and other manuscript materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Radical right collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1990, with additional materials added subsequently.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Radical right collection is comprised of pamphlets, leaflets, newspaper and serial issues, newsletters, bulletins, circulars, and other printed and near-print material issued by right-wing organizations and individuals, largely in the United States. The materials relate to anti-communist, nationalist, fundamentalist, racist, anti-Semitic, neo-Nazi, and other right-wing political movements and concerns in the United States, primarily since World War II. Also includes material relating to world government, education, mental health, fluoridation, and other issues, as well as a few letters and other manuscript materials. The collection contains a number of publications by the John Birch Society, as well as ones pertaining to Gerald L. K. Smith.

The finding aid reflects the original arrangement of the materials. In many cases, these were grouped according to their place of origin. In other cases, they were organized according to title, author, or subject. The incremental materials at the end of the collection did not form part of the original collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes numerous publications of the John Birch Society.

scopecontent.p: Includes numerous publications of the John Birch Society.
